questions.question_text: A company is in the process of combining the human resources and marketing departments. Which of the following describes this change?

comments.content: Ay never mind, I did a practice exam for Kaplan that was almost similar and indeed the answer should be an internal reorganization. Apparently, Business process change does not overhaul a company's department, business units, and employee roles

This is a tough question as I am stuck between A and C. It appears Internal organization isn't a commonly used term unless they meant corporate reorganization. I think I am leaning more on Business process management as it involves anything with redesign and management of a company's internal processes or workflow.

discussion.content: The business processes may change as a result of the combining of departments but the process itself is known as internal reorganization so therefore C is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: C
Process change has to do with how you change doing your reports like going from paper reports to electronic. Internal reorg is what the question describes.
internal reorg - leadership will likely have too many managers and layoff will occur. it a cost savings measure as well
Shouldnt this be regression plan? Revert it because it wont work

comments.content: I agree it should be regression plan. It also mentions it became clear while in testing and could not be finalized, therefore it sounds like the change wasn't officially implemented.

discussion.content: Guys, read the questions carefully. The hint is " it becomes clear that the change cannot be finalized due to the severe impact it would have on other critical systems.

B should be the answer.
Regression analysis technique analyzes the interrelationships between different project variables

questions.question_text: A change is being implemented on a project, and while in testing, it becomes clear that the change cannot be finalized due to the severe impact it would have on other critical systems. Which of the following should the team consult to determine which actions to take?

choices.A: Type of risk, identified risk, risk response, impact of risk, severity of risk
choices.D: Type of risk, identified risk, risk response, impact of risk, risk avoidance
choices.C: Type of risk, identified risk, risk response, project schedule risk, severity of risk
choices.B: Type of risk, project task, risk response, impact of risk, severity of risk

questions.question_text:
A company hires an outside vendor to provide 24/7 support.
Which of the following documents would determine the contractual obligations?

discussion.content: SLA is the service level agreement. As the name implies, is the contract in which the 3rd party group providing the service agrees to fulfill.

questions.question_text: A critical issue has developed in an active project, and the project manager wants to notify the 20-person global project manager use FIRST to relay this information?

comments.content: But are you not scheduling the conference call via email calendar (Outlook, Lotus) and in the subject line you would list critical issue.

discussion.content: The keyword is "first". If we were really concerned with relaying information to users immediately, it should be by email. In addition, you can specify a time to meet with the team by email.

choices.A: Individually call all project team members.
choices.B: Send an email to all project team members.
